Address: 120 E Liberty St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Lively joint combining a bakery, coffee bar & restaurant with New American breakfast & lunch dishes.

parking: Somewhat difficult to find a space

summary.snippet: "We had potato tacos, quesadillas, Irish coffee, sangria, regular coffees."
"Very nice brunch place...busy but very good service, good selections on menu"
"Good food, lively atmosphere (though too loud); Longish wait for Sunday brunch."

most_relevant.description:
The service was fabulous. My dining partner said he has had service before from our same server and that she has been working there for about eight years. I find that amazing in this day and time.
The menu is extremely diverse. They are a breakfast, brunch, lunch restaurant only their menu covers all three!
You can get anything from avocado toast, to oatmeal, to specialty crafted sandwiches and some delicious pancakes and French toast .
The coffee was great too. My dining partner had an orange juice which was freshly squeezed.
If you’re in Ann Arbor in the downtown area, stop in to the Avalon for absolutely exquisite service and food that is stellar!!!

A solid smash for brunch the mushroom burger was my favorite and they had fun cold brew flavors, although the strawberry cold brew had no distinct strawberry flavor to it. The bacon avacado egg sandwich was good but the bread really eroded my mouth it felt like I was chewing for 3 eons, but ig that’s the case with sourdough. Dude also the bacon on the sandwich was delicious. BE WARNED ITS PRICEY🤑

Loved the food! Salmon omelette was amazing, would definitely recommend. Perfect amount of food with the salad and toast on the side. Blueberry pancakes were a great sweet treat after, we got the kids size so the portion was just right.

The food here is amazing but last time I visited the service was horrible. Our waitress took our order and then disappeared for a full hour. Someone else brought our food out, and she did not come back to check how the food was or if we needed anything else. We had finished our food and were sitting waiting for her to come back for 30 minutes before giving up and heading inside to ask for the bill. The host told us he would find her for us and it took another 15 minutes after that for her to bring the bill out. 10 minutes later she still hadn't come back for it and it had started raining so we went inside to have them take the bill so we could leave. We got there around 9:30, were finished eating about 45 minutes later, and weren't able to leave until 11:15. I don't know if our waitress was just having an off day or if something was wrong but it was really disappointing.
Decent spot for a coffee within one of Downtown Ann Arbor’s most scenic spots. Service was pretty good and the coffee itself was great. Can’t really ask for much more.

Great food! We enjoyed the Mushroom Burger, the Roasted Veggie Bowl (with Tofu), the blueberry pancakes from the kids menu, the mushroom gravy, and the potato cakes.

The Avocado toast plated well but wasn't as tasty (the avocado was bland and the toast had the overpowering bitter taste of olive oil) but everything else was top notch. Would highly recommend going to Avalon. Also, the staff was super polite and great hosts :)

The food was good, however the service was terrible. The waiter did not come back to refill our waters the entire hour visit. He didn’t really come back to check on us. When I got up to use the restroom I spotted him chatting with the bartender instead of grabbing our checks. I saw him continuing to chat while we waited for about 15 minutes for our checks to come in.
Generous portion. The fried chicken tasted good. Good food quality while sometimes tastes sour or too salty.
